info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mecklenburg County through 545 PM EDT... At 458 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boydton, or 14 miles southwest of South Hill, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... South Hill, Brodnax, La Crosse, Boydton, Beechwood, John H Kerr Dam, Bracey, Keats, Eppes Fork, Baskerville, Palmer Springs, John H Kerr Reservoir and Lake Gaston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
